sentence.Network_en: Interior decoration by careful coordination seems to have had its day.
sentence.Network_cn: 精心搭配的室内装饰似乎已不再受欢迎了。

sentence.Network_en: The most arresting feature is the painted wall decoration.
sentence.Network_cn: 最醒目的特点是绘有图画的墙面装饰。

sentence.Network_en: His genius was not confined to the decoration of buildings.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的天赋不单体现在建筑物的装饰上。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin decoratio(n-), from the verb decorare (see decorate)

entry.def: The decoration of a room is its furniture, wallpaper, and ornaments.

example.ex: The decoration and furnishings had to be practical enough for a family home...
example.tran: 房子的装潢和家具都必须很实用，适合家居生活。

example.ex: With its simple decoration, the main bedroom is a peaceful haven.
example.tran: 主卧室装饰简单，像一处宁静的港湾。

entry.def: Decorations are features that are added to something in order to make it look more attractive.

example.ex: The only wall decorations are candles and a single mirror...
example.tran: 墙上唯一的装饰是几支蜡烛和一面镜子。

example.ex: The planting of winter and spring-flowering bulbs will supply colourful decoration at a time when most gardens are looking fairly desolate.
example.tran: 栽种冬春季节开花的鳞茎植物可以在大多数花园看上去还比较萧索的时候提供多彩的装点。

entry.def: Decorations are brightly coloured objects such as pieces of paper and balloons, which you put up in a room on special occasions to make it look more attractive.

example.ex: Festive paper decorations had been hung from the ceiling.
example.tran: 喜庆的彩纸已经挂在天花板上。

entry.def: A decoration is an official title or honour which is given to someone, usually in the form of a medal, as a reward for military bravery or public service.

example.ex: He was awarded several military decorations.
example.tran: 他被授予了多枚军功章。

means.word_mean: 2. an award for winning a championship or commemorating some other event
3. the act of decorating something (in the hope of making it more attractive)

auth_sentence.content: Decoration around the top of a wall or building.
auth_sentence.res_content: Decoration around the top of a wall or building.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Decoration around the top of a wall or building.

auth_sentence.content: Slice it very finely and reserve this for decoration.
auth_sentence.res_content: Slice it very finely and reserve this for decoration.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Slice it very finely and reserve this for decoration.

auth_sentence.content: The grand plans for decoration and refurbishment can wait.
auth_sentence.res_content: The grand plans for decoration and refurbishment can wait.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The grand plans for decoration and refurbishment can wait.

sentences.en: A home does not consist in the quality of its architecture and decoration.
sentences.cn: 家之所以为家并不在于住所的设计与修饰。

sentences.en: Decorations are hanging up everywhere in the city on Spring Festival.
sentences.cn: 春节期间城里到处张灯结彩。

sentences.en: The canteen was decked out with Christmas decorations.
sentences.cn: 食堂装点着圣诞节饰品。

sentences.en: The child was attracted by the glitter of the Christmas tree decorations.
sentences.cn: 这孩子被圣诞树上闪闪发光的装饰品吸引住了。

sentences.en: The general wore a decoration on his left breast.
sentences.cn: 那位将军在左胸前佩戴了一枚勋章。
